tourism_level.crowds: Moderate to Low. Quieter, especially towards end of month, except around Oxi Day (Oct 28th).
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder/low season value available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant autumn feel. Good time for museums. Patriotic atmosphere around Oxi Day.

events_holidays.name: Saint Demetrius' Day (Agios Dimitrios)
events_holidays.description: Major local holiday celebrating Thessaloniki's patron saint. Religious services at the Church of Agios Dimitrios, city-wide festivities, often part of Dimitria festival.
events_holidays.notes: Public holiday in Thessaloniki (closures). Church will be very busy. Important local celebration.

events_holidays.name: Oxi Day / National Holiday
events_holidays.description: Commemorates Greece's 'No' to Mussolini in 1940. Celebrated with large military and student parades along the waterfront (Megalou Alexandrou Ave).
events_holidays.notes: Major public holiday. Widespread closures (sites, museums, shops). Central road closures for parade. Check transport schedules.

events_holidays.name: End of Daylight Saving Time
events_holidays.description: Clocks go back one hour, resulting in earlier sunsets.
events_holidays.notes: Impacts evening sightseeing timing.

unique_experiences.description: Witness the impressive military and student parades against the backdrop of the Thermaic Gulf, celebrating Greek national pride.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive very early for a viewing spot. Expect huge crowds and road closures. Dress for the weather.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Church of Agios Dimitrios
unique_experiences.description: Explore the hugely important church dedicated to the city's patron saint, especially significant around Oct 26th. Visit the crypt.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Be respectful (dress code). Expect crowds around the feast day (Oct 26th). Check opening hours (closed Oct 28th).

unique_experiences.where: Historic neighborhood north of city center
unique_experiences.description: Wander the old city walls, discover Byzantine churches, enjoy panoramic views in the clear autumn air.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for steep streets. Find a traditional taverna. Great photo opportunities.

unique_experiences.where: Tsipouradika in Ladadika, Ano Poli, Kapani Market area
unique_experiences.description: Relax indoors at a traditional tsipouradiko, sampling the spirit accompanied by seasonal small plates as evenings get cooler.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ask for seasonal specialties. Lively local atmosphere.

reasons_to_visit.details: September offers a welcome transition from intense summer heat to pleasant warmth (avg. highs 27-29°C). Days are mostly sunny, ideal for exploring the waterfront and city after the August peak.
The sea remains warm enough for comfortable swimming throughout September, perfect for day trips to Halkidiki beaches or nearby coastal areas like Peraia.
Tourist crowds thin out compared to August (though DETH brings many visitors), making visits to the White Tower, museums, and Ano Poli slightly more manageable.
Experience Greece's largest trade fair, a major event attracting huge crowds, exhibitions, concerts, and transforming the city atmosphere, especially in early September.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Good Conditions for Sightseeing & Day Trips
reasons_to_visit.details: More comfortable temperatures make it enjoyable to explore the Roman Forum, walk Ano Poli's alleys, stroll the long waterfront, or take day trips (e.g., Vergina, Mount Olympus) without draining heat.
While the main Athens & Epidaurus Festival winds down, September often sees the start of the new cultural season with concerts, exhibitions, and theatre performances resuming.
Accommodation and flight prices may start to decrease slightly from August highs, especially later in the month, offering better value.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Especially in early September, Thessaloniki can still experience significant heat and humidity, making midday activities uncomfortable.
The Thessaloniki International Fair (early Sept) brings massive crowds, booked-out hotels (at high prices), traffic congestion, and a very busy, less tourist-focused atmosphere in some ways.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Still Relatively Busy / High Season Feel
reasons_to_reconsider.details: September is still popular. Expect significant crowds (especially early month/weekends) and relatively high prices, particularly during DETH.
The Meltemi wind can still blow, sometimes strongly, potentially affecting ferry schedules (especially to Cyclades) and making beaches windy.
The chance of rain increases compared to summer months, particularly later in September. Be prepared for potential showers.
Finding accommodation during the Thessaloniki International Fair without booking far in advance is extremely difficult and expensive. Booking popular restaurants/tours also wise.

weather.precipitation: Low chance of rain, mostly continuation of warm/hot, sunny weather. Humidity can still be noticeable.
weather.general_tips: Pack light summer clothing, swimwear, sunscreen, hat, sunglasses. Stay hydrated. Plan strenuous outdoor activities for early morning or evening.

tourism_level.crowds: Very High, dominated by Thessaloniki International Fair (DETH) visitors early in the month. Extremely busy city center, exhibition grounds, hotels.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak prices, especially for accommodation during DETH. Book months ahead.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Dominated by the buzz and congestion of DETH early September. Feels like late summer otherwise. Warm evenings for waterfront/outdoor dining.

events_holidays.name: Thessaloniki International Fair (DETH)
events_holidays.date: Usually starts the first or second Saturday of Sept, runs for ~9 days
events_holidays.description: Greece's largest trade fair, held at TIF Helexpo grounds. Features numerous pavilions, commercial exhibits, government presence, concerts, and side events.
events_holidays.notes: Major event significantly impacting the city. Check exact dates. Expect crowds, traffic, high hotel prices.

events_holidays.name: Reworks International Music Festival (Potential Dates)
events_holidays.description: Well-regarded electronic and contemporary music festival held at various venues.
events_holidays.notes: Check official website for dates, lineup, and tickets.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the sprawling trade fair (if interested, or just observe the city buzz). Check schedules for associated concerts or public events.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Entry fees apply for fairgrounds. Surrounding area extremely busy. Concerts often held in evenings.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the White Tower (Early Morning / Late Afternoon)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the city symbol when temperatures are slightly cooler. Avoid midday and peak DETH visitor times if possible.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tickets if possible. Bring water, hat. Enjoy the surrounding waterfront park.

unique_experiences.description: Escape potential midday heat or DETH crowds by exploring the rich history of Macedonia in air-conditioned comfort.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 3-4 hours minimum. Easily accessible.

unique_experiences.activity: Evening Stroll & Drinks on the Waterfront
unique_experiences.description: Join the locals for the evening 'volta' (stroll) along the vibrant waterfront promenade, stopping for drinks at a cafe.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Very popular activity. Lots of cafes and bars with outdoor seating.

weather.precipitation: Slightly increased chance of occasional rain showers, but still predominantly sunny and warm.
weather.general_tips: Continue with summer clothing but add a light jacket or cardigan for evenings. Umbrella might be useful.

tourism_level.crowds: High, but significantly decreasing after DETH concludes. Feels more like shoulder season towards month end.
tourism_level.pricing: Prices start to ease, especially later in the month compared to early Sept/August.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant late summer/early autumn transition. City recovers from DETH intensity. Great weather for exploration.

events_holidays.name: Start of Theatre/Concert Season
events_holidays.description: Check local listings as indoor theatres and concert venues begin their new season schedules.
events_holidays.notes: Consult websites like Athinorama (in Greek) or specific venue sites.

events_holidays.name: European Heritage Days (Potential Events)
events_holidays.date: Usually a weekend late September (check dates)
events_holidays.description: May offer free access or special tours to participating museums or sites in Thessaloniki.
events_holidays.notes: Check official announcements closer to the time; participation varies.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the stunning Royal Tombs (including Philip II's) and museum at the first capital of Macedon, enjoying comfortable travel temperatures.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Requires bus, tour, or rental car. Allow most of a day. Mostly indoors (tombs/museum).

unique_experiences.where: Historic district north of city center
unique_experiences.description: Wander the charming alleys, see Byzantine walls/churches (like Osios David), and enjoy panoramic views as the heat eases.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for hills. Find a traditional taverna. Sunset views are excellent.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Museum of Byzantine Culture
unique_experiences.description: Explore the impressive collection related to Byzantine Thessaloniki and Macedonia.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Air-conditioned. Allow 2-3 hours. Good pairing with Archaeological Museum.

unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of the still-pleasant evenings to dine outdoors at the lively tavernas and restaurants in this colourful area.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many options available. Reservations can be useful for popular spots on weekends.
